content.detailedDescription:
Driving on 96 eastbound in brighton, i saw two groups of orange orb like objects in the sky. these were not flares because they split up to form two groups. and headed in different directions..Mainly heading north and east.
they were about as high as a small aircraft would fly, so not very high up at all. plus they were about twice the size as a small aircraft but were round and glowing orange. very simple looking! i noticed these lights because at first it looked like a craft starting to land on an airport, thats how bright they were. 
 

  no flashing lights, no sound, and it was a breezy cloudy night and you could actually see them lowering and then going back up in the clouds...Like they were hiding! many people had to of seen this in oakland and livingston county, you could not miss this. a few cars pulled off the side of the road. it was insane to see that many things in the sky at once and then to see them individually move in different directions!
content.summary: Brighton,mi 7 orange orblike objects reported around 9:53 pm.

content.detailedDescription:
looking ne orange ball shaped bright thought at 1st was a meteor skipping on atmosphere then realized quickly it was moving se for about 3 minutes was bright then it was sitting in a stationary position til a cloud bank took it out of sight. 
  just like to add today was a air show at local base but , this was odd or i would not be here writing it at this moment , went back outside 3 minutes later was gone so was clouds,... strange.
  then came in and thought i would make a report this is my 1st time on this web site.
content.summary: Orange ball looking nw, it was moving se slowly then stopped then hoverd then a cloud bank coverd it.

content.detailedDescription:
This is my second report.  i will send the completed report form to my local field investigator.

aug. 19, 2009 - 01:29.
i had just fed our big dog, who will only eat at night.  i was standing on the deck, looking at the sky. i was looking through binoculars at a cluster of stars at approx. 80 degrees above the horizon, southwest. suddenly something large, red and reflective passed through my field of view. it was traveling exceptionally fast, close and it startled me. i stepped off the deck and into the yard, where another object, then another flew overhead. they were not birds or bats. such creatures do not usually 
produce light.  these objects seemed to be rectangular and had a dim, reddish glow.  i became unnerved by these objects and was about to go back inside, when i looked up and to the east. there was a brightly lit object moving due west to east at 80 degrees. by the time it got to 40 degrees east agl (my vantage point), it vanished. the object was like two orbs connected by a rod, much like a dumbbell/barbell. the light was pure white, with what appeared to be a short flame at the end of the rear orb. there was no meteor-like tail. it did not disappear like a meteor does when it burns up. it was more like disappearing into a dark tunnel. there was no sound associated with this object but as i recall, something might have been "dripping" off the rear orb.  that could explain the orange-like flame.
it seemed to me, that the object was very large and within close proximity to me, between 500 and 1,000 ft.   the object in the depiction i am sending is close to actual size of the object as i witnessed it for 2 brief seconds. i can say that if my spouse had seen this with me, i'd have had to shovel his bottom jaw up off the ground.  he has only seen one strange object in the sky (he was alone at the time), and still isn't sure what it was.
total time of sighting these objects, approx. 1 minute.
1. i was outside with my dog, looking at the sky
2. i saw the first object when it passed through my field of view, while i was looking through binoculars.  something made me stop from going into the house, to turn and look at the dumbbell shaped object.
3. my first thought was, "oh, no!"  fear.
4. the first objects were extremely fast, yet close to me, within probably 30 feet.  they moved so fast i only caught glimpses.  the white object moved in a straight trajectory from west to east and vanished.
5. my first reaction was to get back into the house as quickly as possible. why i stopped, i do not know.  after i saw these objects i felt very uneasy, still do.
6. the bright white dumbbell shaped object vanished and i beat a hasty retreat into the house.  where the other objects went, i don't know.
content.shape: Cylinder,  Fireball,  Sphere,  Square,  Rectagular,  Other
content.summary: Several rectangular, dimly glowing reddish objects and one white dumbbell/barbell shaped glowing white object

content.detailedDescription:
I stepped outside at 2220 (+/-2 mins) for a cigarette. as soon as i did i noticed 2 large orange lights in the sky, i'd estimate around 2,000-5,000ft altitude maximum travelling at high speed from my 1 o'clock to over my left shoulder. the 2 lights could have been joined (the lights appeared to 'reach' towards each other more than they radiated in other directions) so could have been one object - they were certainly either in strict formation or joined.

lights were approximately the size of the full moon (so big, noticeable) and the most noticeable thing about them was the distortion apparent, like nothing i've ever seen; imagine sort of the pixellisation mtv etc use to hide brand logos, blocky/blurry effect constantly changing over the lights, introducing black 'patches'.

the lights travelled in a constant curved path overhead, speed difficult to estimate but certainly faster than helicopters which sometimes fly over so not lanterns, no other lights so not aircraft flying in accordance with regs. no change in velocity or direction (ballistic trajectory).

i first thought they were meteorites as that would explain the speed and trajectory (and parallel paths) but given the size, speed and altitude they'd have made one hell of a mess when they hit and having seen fast jets before these looked supersonic, but made no noise.

they passed over the roof of my house and out of sight.

it happened very fast but the distortion (not visible anywhere else in the sky, or in the region they traversed before/after they did) spooked me slightly as it was very, very weird - like a visual camouflage almost. nothing like heat haze.

colour was very similar to sodium streetlights.

i've thought and thought about it but other than a pair of identically-sized meteorites travelling silently, low and fast there's not much that could explain this. not aircraft due to lack of running lights and noise, not lanterns or rockets due to the distortion effect and speed.

stone cold sober, wearing my glasses, familiar with everything normally seen in the sky (heathrow flight path overhead - but much, much higher).

looking at the mufon records there's a hell of a lot of orange things in the skies over britain, but none that i've found have this "fuzzy" appearance, speed or size.

i now keep my slr by my back door :d
content.summary: Pair of blurry/pixellated orange orbs or lights, large, fast, low, silent,

content.detailedDescription:
It was monday night august 17th, 2009 at around 11pm to midnight sometime. i didn't have a watch on. my brother, his girlfriend and her sister and i where all in the row boat, my brother was driving the boat with the motor. we made our way around for probably 20 min and slowed down and decided to drift.

we sat there for a bit, and i began to look up and saw 2 white lights round and looked unusual to anything else i normally see in the sky. so i was like huh.

i let everyone on the boat know and as i watched it, at that point it started moving. it was right above us when i first saw it, and had a feeling it had been there. the 2 lights where round and fixed apart and the light was the same brightness as the moon is. so, as all of us became aware of it, it moved to our right or the west very slowly and very slowly dimmed its lights off.

this whole experience was probably about 20 to 40 seconds. i was unable to see any shape to the object, it was dark but the stars where out, but it had been hazy in the evening before but was still clear out. the height of the object in the sky appeared to be up there a bit but not super high or super low, maybe 5 to 10,000 feet, not sure.

it was strange how it was above us and then when we became aware if it it dimmed its lights very slowly and moved slowly but surely to the west. there was no noise. it was an unusual experience.
content.summary: Sighting over lake huron.

content.detailedDescription: About three years ago my friends and i were at the beach.  the sun had set and the sky was getting darker but was still quite blue.  my twin brother and i were looking towards the parking lot at the western sky and noticed a bright 'star'.  we were quite surprised by it, we are frequent star gazers and have never noticed a star this bright at this time of night.  we decided it must be a planet, because the object was brighter than a star, but what planet could it be?  it was a perfect circle and bigger than stars are but it was still quite small.  i think we both were thinking 'ufo' but it was not moving and for all we knew it could be a planet, as no star would be that bright.  we pointed it out to our friends who thought it strange but were not as interested in it.  we pulled ourselves away from observing the 'star' and followed our friends down the beach a bit.  we returned to the spot about 10 to 20 minutes later and the 'star' was still there.  my twin and i stopped to watch it before returning to our car.  it was in the same spot, you couldn't miss it.  we then watched it do something amazing - it winked out!  it was as if someone had a lightswitch dimmer and dimmed it until it disappeared.  this shocked my brother and i, we both exclaimed, "did you see that!?" but no one else was watching the object.  my twin and i were very excited and kind of shocked at what we had just seen, deciding among ourselves that we had just seen a ufo.
content.summary: A large star was observed around sunset at the beach.  we then watched it 'dim' out

content.detailedDescription: Two days ago i was looking for unidentifiables, expecting to see nothing i watch the clouds laying in my lawn chair recliner with binocs glued to my head scanning the sky, high in the north western sky i noticed a very small shinny objects travelling in front of the clouds on a slow consistent south west path. i observed it for a good 20 minutes when my neighbour startled me to ask to check why the sink leaks. about 10-15 minutes later i was outside again trying to find where it had gone. from my first observation i predicted that if on the same path it would be somewhere in front of it(obviously) after looking all over, to my excitement i had found it again. it appeared much farther away. in the back of my mind from when i frist saw it i had been telling myself to grab my telescope and have a look, but hesitated. i figured i would lose it and never see it again doing so. after a long viewing of the object through binoculars and not seeing much more than a point of silver light i took my telescope out and tried to find it. it took me a while to find. by now it was low in the west travelling what seemed to be farther away and creeping north. i took about 30 pictures through my telescope in magnifications ranging from 48x96x and 120x the pictures were quite blury due to my lack of camera skills. i then used the cameras video recording option and recorded 3 clips 2 in 120x mag and 1 in 48x magnification. the object was perfect round. on the clips the scope is bouncing slightly due to wind and shifts when i attempt to center the object. the picture i am sending is taken from the third video and sharpened with paint shop pro, and is my fav image from the event so far. i would like to think it is a weatherballoon but the characteristics of the objects and what i have been seeing on the internet, leed me to think otherwise. maybe someone can debunk this.
content.summary: Silver object spotted in binos recorded through my telescope with handheld video camera

content.detailedDescription:
This is 1 of 3 sightings i had on august 19, 2009.  i will post each one separately, as requested by the local mufon field investigator.  i am sending her completed sights report forms, so contacting me will not be necessary.

please not: the time on this report is erroneous.  your online form would not accept 00:35 hours.

my report is as follows:
it was august 19, 2009, at 00:35 (12:35 a.M.).  i opened my front door (facing north) and saw what at first appeared to be a commercial jet, heading west to east. however, it looked to be at least 3 times the size of a jumbo jet, if it were at the same cruising altitude. all i could see was a string of perhaps 15 red and white lights (like a string of beads) all the way across, from what would be wingtip to wingtip. two of the center white lights seemed to flash alternately, once every second. there were no lights fore or aft, no green nav light.  if there was a fuselage, i could not see it, there just weren't any other lights.  the string of lights appeared to be moving at about the same or slower speed as a commercial jet. the object(s) continued on to the east and i stepped back inside to grab my camera, which took all of 5 seconds. when i looked again, the object was gone.  just before this sighting i had seen a jet far to my ne, putting it far ahead of the unidentified object.
i hear jets passing overhead all the time, as we are in the flight path to dfw.  there is also a local airport not far behind our property, with an aviation museum.  i have video of a vintage military airplane flying directly over my house (close) and then landing at the airfield. i hear the normal aircraft activity each day but i did not hear any sound from the lights.
1. i was at home and opened my door to look outside.
2. i noticed a jet (far to my ne) and then saw what appeared to be a string of lights in the sky directly north of me.
3. i first thought it was an odd jet but it had way too many lights and none fore, or aft.  could not see a structure/frame/fuselage.
4. up to 15 alternating red and white lights in a row, like string of beads.  they were in a perfect line (north to south), moving west to east.
5. i felt perplexed, then i knew this was not a normal aircraft.  
6. the lights disappeared while i grabbed for my camera.
content.summary: I saw a string of red and white lights traveling west to east

content.detailedDescription: I was a security officer waiting for my relief to show up at 2345 hours, in troy, mt. on august 10, 2009.  while waiting for him i looked skyward & saw this object moving left to right across the sky north-south? about this time my relief arrived & i pointed this object out to him.  he claims to have seen ufo's before & when he saw this object he went running down the street to tell two other security officers watching another site. i don't believe the other two security officers witnessed this event, but we did. it was a large/huge rectangle shaped object (reminded me of a gigantic gum eraser) with 1-2 constant white lights towards the front & one rotating/blinking(not sure which)red light towards the rear.  absolutely no noise & stayed at a constant speed.  it was probably in view for 5-10 minutes & then disappeared over a mountain range.  the sky was clear & starlit.  it appeared to be between the north star & our observation. we were standing on spokane avenue in the middle of the city of troy, mt.  never having observed a "ufo" before i can't tell you what it was, but it wasn't an airplane and didn't see any wings! my initial reaction was "gee, look at that"  the following days up to today i'm starting to get more excited.  i'm more of a maybe there is-maybe there isn't type of person. this sighting is pushing me towards a believer. - bm
content.summary: Saw large rectangular shape with 1-2 constant white light in front & one rotating/blinking red light towards the rear

content.detailedDescription:
woke up a little after 4am to smoke a cigg. like i normally do around that time and looked up in the sky to see a moving star. i didnt see any flashing lights and it was really quite. so i continued to watch as it seemed real close to the ground to be a star? anyway it continued north east kinda slow and fast, sometimes it would dim and then get bright. i lost it over time cause of the trees but it was definitly not anything i've ever seen.
   as i was watching that one i noticed a larger star like object, also too close to the ground to be a star just hovering over like st. paul, it was doing the same dim then get bright but it never moved so i went back to sleep, tried too anyway.
content.summary: Moving slow in a sort of zig-zag motion and it was real quite

content.detailedDescription:
When driving home on north little mountian road i noticed approximately 6 blue colored lights hovering together in a northern location from my residence and remained in same position for approximately 15-20 minutes. i first noticed them just as i was preparing to turn into my complex. i pulled over to watch them and attempt to video them with my camera phone. the objects then seperated slowly first moving in an east direction and then 3 continued in a northern direction towards the cajon pass and 3 headed in a northeastern direction towards lake arrowhead. the event lasted approximately 30 minutes or more. there were numerous persons in the area observing the same incident. the objects appeared small and blue and often had a flash coming from them. 

when i first observed these things i though that they must be some kind of toys as there are persons who fly remote control airplains from the top of little mountian, but realized this was not possible as they were hovering and in formation. i then thought that it must be some kind of military operation, but it is nothing like i have ever seen before. 

i live in the flight path for civilian aircraft of ontario airport and there are jets that fly over my location. during the time of these object appearing one ject flew over right at the start and no further aircraft flew by while i was trying to observe these objects (unusual jets fly by every 5-10 minutes).
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 6 light objects hovered over area and then seperated

content.detailedDescription: I was looking out my south facing windows in south poway at about 945 pm last night, all of a sudden, with no sound, a bright emerald coloured meteorite like object came streaking out of the sky at a 45 degree angle, it was like a very bright meteorite except it was bright emerald, itr left no gas trails even though i have seen large meteorites (though still smaller than this one) before and they have, and although it got brighter as it streaked down towards the earth, it did get brighter and continued to become more luminescent, it went behind a small ridge to the south, and i could still see a green glow for a few seconds,  on the other side of the ridge is marine corps air station miramar.
content.summary: Bright emerald colour, looked like a giant green meteorite

content.detailedDescription: At the time i was looking out my back window when i noticed that there was this tiny black dot in the sky. so i went and got my binochlears and i swear it was a flying saucer! at first i just couldnt believe it. it just hovered and kept on slowly moving. i felt like the cartoon where its eyes pop out of the other end of the binochlears. it was amazing. eventually it was so far away i couldnt see the black dot anymore so i went inside. it was pretty cool i got it on film.
content.summary: It was hovering over lake havasu.

content.detailedDescription:
While driving southbound on north 83rd st, just south of yellowstone rd, my husband and i both saw a strobe type light blinking. it initally appeared to me to be eastbound in the vicinity of woodland rd.  it then became clear that it was headed toward us, at approximately treetop level (20-30 ft above the ground).  as we were traveling southbound, it passed us on the east going north above an empty field.  the strobe pattern was a 2 out of 3 type pattern, 1-2-off,1-2-off.  the light was very bright, making it impossible to tell size or distance.

initially i thought the light was the side of the light bar on a sheriff vehicle or ambulance going east on woodland rd.  my husband thought it was a warning light on a tower, although there are no radio towers in that direction.  as the direction changed, and it came toward us, we both realized that we didn't know what it was.
content.summary: Strobe type light traveling north at treetop level

content.detailedDescription:
I sleeping, when i suddenly get up. i couldn`t get to sleep. i go to terrace to look the stars. in front of me, near to big house i see the ufo. it is look like ball with orange light. from ufo get out and get in smaller ball.
i did not scare. only want to sleep.
after 2 nights i see it again but in different place. it was in front of me (i was in the bed). i see it for 4-5 sec and fall asleep.
after 2 nights i see it again. but this it was very far (you can see it on the photo). i look it 40 min. it was moving. but it is hide behind a big building.
content.summary: Looks like a ball with orange light.

content.detailedDescription:
My neighbor knowcked on my door around 9:20pm august 22, 2009.  i ws just watching tv.  she said, come out side, there are ufos.  i was afraid to go out, but i did.  over her house - facing north east - was this orange glowing firball moving slowing up from the horizon heading south west directly towards us.  they were below the cloudline, and moving very slowly - almost floating accross the sky.  they were not hot air balloons, and not fireworks, as the airport suggested there were fireworks in louisville, but then they would have been coming from south west to north east and not vice versa.  and they didn't look anything like a firework i had seen.  these were some kind of a craft - a round object that would rise above into the sky and then seem to fizzle out before it disappeared, all around the same spot.

then, we saw more.  sometimes in pairs, sometimes one at a time.  my neighbor saw three at a time in a triangular shape prior to coming to get me.  one of them separated from the trio and went higher.  i we called some more neighbors out and i called my husband and parents.  my parents drove down to north canton.  they didn't see anything in the sky on the drive down.  

the lights finally stopped coming around 10:00, but resumed after my parents arrived, around 10:40pm.  this time we saw two sets of pairs floating in the sky.  depending on how far away they were it resembled either an oval/disc or a circle.  they were just these glowing, almost firelike balls.  they seemed to flicker like a candle would as they went by and eventually they disappeared.  again, they were orange and would rise from northeast and head straight towards us, sw.... low flying - above the trees and below the clouds.  they were very slow moving, slower than a blimp.  and completely silent.  we heard no noise at all with them, and when planes went by we heard the planes.  

altogether, there were ten of us that watched them floating by us.  we were both fascinated and frightened.  my neighbor reported it to the airport, they had her continue to call as she saw them.  they said they do not know what it is, all they can guess according to the sheriff was fireworks from louisville, but again, it was coming from the wrong direction to be louisville.  my mom recorded some video on her cell phone.  i'm waiting for her to send it to me.  

by 11:30pm, we hadn't seen any for about 15 minutes and all decided to go in our houses.  i went to bed, locked all the doors and barricaded them so no one - or no thing - could get in.
content.summary: Over 20  orange balls of fire seem to float accross the sky in north canton

content.detailedDescription:
I was on the lake (clear lake) and we were about ready to watch the fireworks and i looked up and saw two orange lights. they were stagered. one started to fade and disapeared and the other started to fade and before it disapeared it shot strait up into the sky.

then a week or two later i was on the boat at the coralville dam and i saw another orange light but this time it was flying in a steady path i would say from north to south and it faded and disapeared shortly before the horizong.

then just tonight (08-23-09) i was on my couch at about 12:30 a.M. and i heard a noise outside. it sounded like a truck idling. so i went outside and saw what looked like three jet engines in a triangle shape moving directly away from me and it sounded like the woosh of a blow torch but was constant and loud. it looked like the back of a space shuttle. it was one craft. but its tregectory was horizontal and it just kept going. it was traveling norht east. i watched it until it was out of sght due to the horizon.

the first two sightings did not make any noise. they were completely silent.  this last one had a flashing light on top it appeared but the three lights were the part that confused me and i have never heard this sound before. it was also very low to the ground.
content.summary: Three orange ufo sightings in two months.

content.detailedDescription:
I live in glendora, california.  on august 21, 2009, as i was about to go to bed around 10:15pm, a bright light outside my west facing window caught my attention.  it was a bright orange colored round light that was fairly slow moving.  i told my wife that it might be a ufo sighting, she thought i was crazy, so i told her to take a look as well.  

it seemed like it was about 1-2 miles away from where we live (maybe over azusa, california) and it went from north to south.  it was flying at slow pace for about 10-15 seconds going south, then it stopped.  it stayed at that same location for another 30-40 seconds or so.  i went and grabbed my camera but when i came back, it started moving southwest and higher into the sky.  as it proceeded in that direction, the brightness of the object went out from time to time until it finally disappeared.  the whole sighting lasted about 1-2 minutes.  

i am not sure what to make of this event.  i have never seen a ufo before, but i have always believed that there are other beings out there in the universe.  maybe that was a visit from the outer universe... maybe.
content.summary: Circular flying object over san gabriel valley in los angeles

content.detailedDescription: I was outside on the south side of my house just looking up at the sky like i usually do. (i am very interested in astronomy.) a gold light went from east to west, faster than a high plane (like the usual planes that fly overhead) but it was definitely high altitude. it was a gold ball of light, no blinking. it went a long ways, much farther than a meteor would (which i've seen many of, as well as meteor showers) and it was much brighter than a meteor. it was a bright gold light as long as i saw it, and did not change shape. i tried to move to the north side of my house to keep it in view, but it either disappeared by the time i got there or was blocked by trees. the irony is i was just shooting videos on my hd camera and didn't have it in hand at the time. there was no cloud cover or possible reflection from lights in the town i'm in.
content.summary: Gold light

content.detailedDescription:
I was on vacation with my spouse in a small town in nova scotia. the area has no street lights what-so-ever. supposedly we saw on cbc news that within the week there would be meteor showers so every night we went to to watch the stars. i saw many shooting stars and satellites during this time. two nights before my departure, august 16, 2009, we open the front door to see an incredibly bright neon green light in the sky race across the sky in a zig-zag pattern and vanished into the night sky. it was bright enough to immediately capture both of our eyes and stun any further movements from either one of us. 

the light was bright neon green, it left a tail as it moved in a zigzagged pattern. it was absolute silence, this area is forest and farm land. also, it moved very very quickly yet in a "smooth" manner. it's acceleration seemed effortless to best describe this smoothness. it didnt jerk like a car would when you step on the gas pedal... it just slided. 

the event was scary enough that we were stunned and had a small discussion about not going out to watch the stars that night. i was not looking forward to an encounter!

i've watched ufo hunters on the history channel. i've had experiences with ufo events during my early childhood and i already had an interest in this but i never thought i would witness anything like this again in my lifetime.

i shared this story with locals who have lived in the area their entire life and they have never heard of a green light in the sky and they were quite surprised/shocked. a military base is nearby but the locals are well aware of the air crafts and jets that fly in their skies. the person i spoke to in particular is building his own air plane so he was a credible person to talk to about flying green air crafts.
content.summary: Neon green light w/ tail, zigzag pattern, silent

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription: As a newly licensed school bus driver for carmel clay schools, i exited my parked bus at the westside transportation facility at 12400 shelborne, carmel, hamilton county, indiana. i stood in the parking lot and looked north to watch a turboprop twin engine beechcraft king air flying south at 1000 feet above ground level (agl) .25 mile to the east of my position. it turned from south to west and flew over my position, then, when .25 mile west of my position it turned to a heading of approximately north and lowered landing gear and flaps and began a 3 degree descent presumably to executive airport located four miles north of my position. i am a commercial pilot certificate holder, airplane single and multi engine land and instruments. i also hold a certified flight instructor, instruments certificate for single engine airplanes. it was pleasant to watch the aircraft execute its approach. the airplane was about a mile north of its turn onto final approach when i observed a straight black horizontal line .25 mile directly west of the aircraft at a slightly higher level than the aircraft. the aircraft was descending through approximately 750 feet agl. the black, crisply shaped, thin rectangle could be called a thick black line about one inch long when seen from my position. i thought it was a large black bird with its wings outstretched flying on a thermal. the line was too perfectly straight to be a bird, however. birds on thermals have a slight dihedral or upswept or downswept wingtips, and their bodies make small adjustments to dynamic flight conditions. this bird had no flex to the wings, nor a body. i ignored the airplane and stayed fixed on the bird to see what it would do next. i blinked my eyes  and the straight line "bird" was completely, abruptly, and suddenly gone and seemingly replaced by a thin flat disc on its edge! that it was smooth, flat, and of an unpainted metal color was very obvious by the fact that it accurately reflected the color of the sky and the scattered cumulus clouds enveloping it as they passed from west to east at 1000 to 1500 feet agl. there was no convex character of the surface. it was perfectly and precicely flat. i believe the black line was the appearance of the edge of the object when it was positioned parallel to earth's surface like a coin placed placed flat on a surface. my estimation of dimensions is that the black line was three feet thick. its diameter, when seen while in its vertical position like a coin placed on its edge, was fifty feet. that it was a controlled machine was perfectly obvious in that, despite the wind, it stayed in exactly one position over the ground. further, it was perfectly stable with no wobble, bobble or oscillation. it was precisely fixed in the vertical attitude and in one location. after many moments, it released its hold on its position and drifted leisurely eastward with the wind. i did not want to blink again for fear that it would change yet again. i did not want to lose sight of it. i had to blink, however, so i did so as quickly as possible. during my blink the object dissappeared. my eyes searched and searched for it and were unable to locate it again. when i realized it was gone i felt i had been treated with contempt by the operators of the machine. i felt and still feel that i saw it quite clearly, that i can probably deal with the reality and agenda of its operators, and that the operators of the machine underestimate observers and are disrespectful to us in making the apparatus suddenly dissappear without explanation, or movement, or a trail to satisfy our sense of logic. on the other hand, what if they are hostile to us? frankly, this sequence of events makes more sense to me if this was a hostile use of our airspace.
content.summary: Horizontal black line became a silvery disc on its edge holding its position notwithstanding wind.

content.detailedDescription:
1. downtown kansas city, mo watching annual air show.
2. watching fighter jet during show, looking up and noticed star-like objects.
3. star, plane, etc.
4. there were 9 objects that i could see. they were spaced out but within close proximity to each other. they weren't moving or flying like a plane or satellite would. then some would disappear. eventually there were 3 then one. they just disappeared.
5. i was very curious and excited when i saw the objects. a crowd of 10+ were all looking at them. i'm sure many more people saw them. all i had was my phone and it wouldn't have been able to pick them up through the camera because they were so high and small. i saw commercial jets fly by and i knew that they were not planes. nor satellites because they didn't really move.
6. a few at a time, they would just disappear. eventually, it was down to 3. when i lost all of them i walked away then looked up and saw one by itself. then it disappeared.
content.summary: Kc air show ufo sighting.

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting outside on the hood of marks sisters car watching falling stars. that day we were watching tv, on the news they said there would be a nice light show in the sky...All the falling stars. so thats what we did. about 30 min. later mark saw a light in the sky, he said look a flying saucer. i looked over at it and said it was a plane with its lights on. then it stoped moving,he said can planes do that i told him it was a helicopter. at this time it was around 1/4 mile away from us flying around then in a flash it was gone. we didnt know what to think. im not sure maybe 10 min.Later thats when it started one after another at least 10 or more flew close by us, one came around 20 feet from us and about 3 feet off the ground. i asked mark too come over and look at it with me he wouldnt get off the car. i walked over only to stop 10 feet from it. i dont remember seeing any markings on it or windows it looked to be around 15 feet long. what i thought was strange it didnt make any noise im still trying to remember if lights were flashing on the side. it stayed there maybe 2 min. then moved away slowly behind a garage and trees. i walked around the garage only to see it was gone. i walked back to the car where mark was, sat on the hood and talked about what we saw. at that time it was getting really dark out think it was around 10:00.There was a big field across marks sisters apt. and we saw a huge ufo it had to be at least 300 feet long. at this time we were getting a little scared. we ran inside to wake up marks brother inlaw he walked out to the back door looking at this large ufo. he didnt say one word turned around and went back to bed. we called one of our friends and told him what we saw. he thought we were making fun of him... he was into ufo's reading books and all, we used to tease him about it. anyway mark told him to go outside and watch for flying saucers. we went back outside they were all gone we sat outside for awhile longer but didnt see nothing. nor did our friend dave. the next day we told everyone what we had seen. i dont have to tell you what they thought... but the next day people started calling in about ufo's they saw the night before.  jim r.  this happend in 1975
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: A friend told me there would be lot's of falling stars that night. so we sat outside to watch. thats when mark saw the first one.

content.detailedDescription: I was in my backyard taking photos of the clouds to the north of palm springs when i uploaded the photos i saw what looks like an orb in one of the shots i blew it up and the more i blow it up the more it looks like a ufo
content.summary: Orb matalic silver/gray

content.detailedDescription: Since 2005, i have been visited by many aliens. i captured their photos. here is my story on my blog ([cms/tg/pid] ). you are welcome to come for an investigation. my alien photos have been sent to a few scientists and ufo researchers. due to inconviences, i cannot send them to you.
content.summary: Long term visitation

content.detailedDescription:
I took a photo on the way over to a boating party held the 3rd saturday of august every year.  it was mostly a far shot of the boats anchored on the island.  when i got home i transfered the photo from my cell phone to my computer and cropped most of the sea and sky away.  thats when i noticed this sky blue object over the island.  just for your information, this island is across the bay from earle ammunition base.   it was to high in the sky for a balloon which i thought it was at first.   i sent the photo on to someone that may have had better close-up program.  here is what i have if i am able to download photos if not then feel free to call or email me helainenj@aol.Com or 908-309-9449
helaine camacho
content.summary: When i took the photo i didnt even see it there.  daytime ufo

content.detailedDescription:
Forest, ontario. january 9, 2009. 14:30 hrs. est.

   witness (c.C.) was outside walking her dog along the old railway track trail, when she noticed a small plane approaching over the nearby field and trees. there was a small (size of a car tire) dark silver ball near the wing of the plane, which she first thought might be an attached camera.
   as the plane flew low overhead (100 feet?), the ball flew or "rolled" around the wing of the plane, then moved behind the plane and became stationary.
   c.C. started to feel strange (movement and thinking impaired)as if inside some kind of "bubble". her dog also appeared "dazed". time seemed to stand still.
   the plane made a u turn to come back towards the ball. when the plane
approached to within a couple hundred feet, the ball "blinked out".
   the witness watched the plane search for the ball for a while, then went home.
   she was tired and had trouble standing when she arrived home at approximately 15:45 hrs. 
   c.C. called her mother on a cell phone to report her experience.
   the witness and her dog are now afraid to return to the location of the sighting.
content.summary: Sighted small sphere maneuvering around airplane.

content.detailedDescription: My friends and i (6 of us total) were visiting the neighborhood pond when one of us called out to point out a lighted object far off in the dark sky. we watched the object circle around and one of my friends and i had jokingly called out, "haha look it's a ufo!" two of the guys with us decided it looked like a blimp judging on the lights positioning. i snapped a pic of the aircraft on my cell phone while it was still visable. the object had flown just out of sight behind some trees. we all were stunned at the thought of what that could have been. finally everyone agreed that it had to have been a blimp. approx. 2 min later the lights from before were much brighter now and behind us. we all turned around to see the object from before up close and right in front of us but just above the tree line. the aircraft, about the size of a small house, hovered while continuing to move right above our heads. at this point we could see the distinct outline of a very thin triangular shaped black object. numerous lights lit up the underneath and a slight hum could be heard, but nothing like an airplane or a jet engine. my friends and i just watched it pass and as we were all in shock, nobody could get out their phone for a closer picture. just after passing us and the small pond, the triangular aircraft increased speed and took off. the object disappeared within the blink of an eye. i was in complete shock as i had never seen anything like this before in my life.
content.summary: Triangular shaped thin black object (about the size of a small house) with numerous lights underneath passed directly over my friends and i just above treetop height.

content.detailedDescription:
Forest, ontario. october 20, 2008. 22:30 hrs. edst.

   witness (c.C.) was outside walking her dog when a distant bright object caught her attention. it appeared to be a bright white glowing ball, with fuzzy edges or an aura, about the size of the moon.
   she continued to watch the object move slowly (2 mph?) over the town, while continuing her walk. when the object passed over the nearby royal bank at a height of approximately 100 feet, she realized it wasn't an airplane or helicopter (silent, no blinking lights), so she ran back to her home to get a pair of binoculars. by the time the witness ran back outside, the object had disappeared.
   c.C. felt excited and confused (seeing things?)after her sighting.
content.summary: Bright white ball of light moving slowly over town.

content.detailedDescription:
I was just outside greenbush, mi in a cabin "resort" called the blue haven resort.  it is located on the shoreline of lake huron.

at approximately 10:30pm, i received a voicemail on my cell phone an exited the cabin to listen.  as i was listening to the voicemail and looking out over lake huron, i started to notice stationary "yellowish/orange" lights.  these lights would turn on for about 5-10 seconds and then turn off.  the lights were bright enough to cast a reflection on the lake.  once the light turn off another light would turn on in a slightly different location, maybe next adjacent to the 1st light or down the shoreline a short distance.  i called my family out and we watched for about 20 minutes and saw about 30-40 lights.  

the lights were located due east over the lake and approximately 30 degrees up the night sky.  in the sky to the se was a very visible star/planet, whose light was bright white and was the brightest object in the eastern sky.  my flashing lights were approximately the same height in the sky.

after about 20 minutes another couple that was having a bonfire on the beach joined us and said they had been watching the light for about an hour.  at this point a single light turned on directly east of us.  as we watched 2 more lights turned on, one on either side of the original and parralell to the ground.  then two more lights turned on, again one on either side of the now three lights.  this created 5 lines in a straightline, parralell to the ground.  these lights stayed on for a few seconds and then contracted back to the single point of light and turned off.  my daughter then was freaked out so we went in for the night.

i know that the annual meteor shower had happened the night before so i assumed that is what we say.  but these lights were fixed in place and were perfectly round.  no what i would expect from a meteor shower.

they were more like lights on an anchored boat, but were far too high in sky to be a boat.

i know that the old air force base in oscoda, mi is closed, but was being used that night for training exercises between the us and dutch air force.  we heard and saw military planes during the day.  these planes are moving and very load.  our lights were not moving and completely silent.

on the following monday, i called the oscoda and alcona county police to see if anyone had reported this event.  both reported that no other reports were made.

i have a technical background and always try to look for a logical explaination.  at this point, i have eliminated the logical.
content.summary: Contiuous flashes of lights over lake huron
